definition: to reduce, lessen
sentence: The storm refused to abate, so our picnic turned into an indoor floor-sandwich situation.

definition: to shorten or condense
sentence: My teacher asked me to abbreviate my twenty-page essay, so I cut it down to nineteen and called it progress.

definition: departing from the normal or expected
sentence: Finding a penguin in the desert would be pretty aberrant, even for a nature documentary gone wrong.

definition: something that differs from the norm
sentence: Getting an A in gym class was such an aberration that my mom framed the report card.

definition: to aid, help, encourage
sentence: My dog abetted my little brother's cookie heist by distracting me with an aggressive tail wag.

definition: to hate, detest
sentence: I abhor waking up early so much that my alarm clock and I are no longer on speaking terms.

definition: to put up with; to remain
sentence: I can abide most things, but pineapple on pizza is where I draw the line.

definition: wretched, pitiful
sentence: After burning dinner for the third time, I sat in abject defeat staring at the smoke detector.

definition: denial of comfort to oneself
sentence: Her abnegation of dessert lasted exactly four minutes before the brownies called her name.

definition: to formally put an end to
sentence: If I could abolish one thing, it would be the existence of Monday mornings.

definition: extremely unpleasant; causing disgust
sentence: The cafeteria's mystery meat was so abominable that even the flies avoided it.

definition: inhabiting a land from the earliest times
sentence: The aboriginal peoples of Australia developed sophisticated techniques for surviving the harsh outback.

definition: failing to achieve the intended result
sentence: His abortive attempt to cook Thanksgiving dinner ended with the fire department on speed dial.

definition: to cut down, shorten; shortened
sentence: They abridged the four-hour movie into a two-hour version, and honestly, nobody missed the subplot about the goat.

definition: to abolish, usually by authority
sentence: The principal abrogated the no-phone rule during the field trip, and chaos immediately followed.

definition: sudden and unexpected
sentence: The movie's abrupt ending left everyone in the theater yelling at the screen.

definition: the natural cutting off or separation
sentence: In autumn, abscission causes leaves to fall, giving trees their annual dramatic costume change.

definition: to declare free from guilt or blame
sentence: The cat's adorable face absolved her of all guilt for knocking the vase off the shelf.

definition: to freely choose not to commit an action
sentence: I tried to abstain from snacking, but the chips in the pantry were basically screaming my name.

definition: moderate and restrained in eating and drinking
sentence: My abstemious grandmother eats one small portion and then watches the rest of us stuff ourselves.

definition: existing in thought rather than having physical form
sentence: His painting was so abstract that people couldn't tell if it was a horse or a filing cabinet.

definition: hard to comprehend
sentence: The professor's explanation was so abstruse that even the smartest student just nodded and Googled it later.

definition: a very large quantity of something
sentence: There was such an abundance of pizza at the party that we ate it for breakfast, lunch, and dinner the next day.

definition: existing in great quantity; plentiful
sentence: Squirrels were so abundant in the park that you couldn't take a step without tripping over one.

definition: extremely offensive and insulting
sentence: The coach's abusive yelling made everyone on the team dread practice.

definition: to agree
sentence: After an hour of begging, my parents finally acceded to letting me adopt the stray kitten.

definition: to increase in speed or rate
sentence: The car began to accelerate so fast that my cheeks literally flattened against my skull.

definition: to stress, highlight
sentence: The bright red scarf accentuated her outfit so perfectly it looked like a magazine cover.

definition: obtainable, reachable
sentence: The new ramp made the library accessible to everyone, including my grandpa and his speedy wheelchair.

definition: high praise
sentence: The young chef received so much acclaim for her pasta that she opened a restaurant at age sixteen.

definition: to become accustomed to a new environment
sentence: It took me a full month to acclimate to the cold after moving from Florida to Minnesota.

definition: high praise, special distinction
sentence: Winning the science fair was the biggest accolade of his middle school career.

definition: to provide lodging or adjust to fit
sentence: The tiny apartment could barely accommodate two people, let alone three cats and a tuba.

definition: a partner in committing a crime
sentence: My sister was my accomplice in sneaking cookies from the jar while Mom was on the phone.

definition: to achieve or complete successfully
sentence: She managed to accomplish in one afternoon what the rest of us couldn't do in a week.

definition: an agreement
sentence: The two rival clubs reached an accord to share the gym on alternate Tuesdays.

definition: to confront verbally
sentence: A stranger accosted me on the street to ask if I'd heard about his sandwich shop.

definition: to accumulate or receive over time
sentence: Interest continues to accrue in a savings account, so your money slowly grows while you sleep.

definition: biting, bitter in tone or taste
sentence: Her acerbic review of the restaurant mentioned that the salad tasted like 'angry lettuce.'

definition: relating to or containing vinegar or acid
sentence: The acetic smell of vinegar filled the kitchen when she started making her famous pickles.

definition: a continuous dull pain
sentence: After running my first marathon, every muscle in my body seemed to ache in protest.

definition: to successfully reach a goal through effort
sentence: She worked late every night to achieve her goal of graduating at the top of her class.

definition: having a sharp, sour quality; low pH
sentence: The lemonade was so acidic it made my face scrunch up like a raisin.

definition: to accept or recognize as true
sentence: He refused to acknowledge his mistake, even when the evidence was literally taped to his forehead.

definition: the highest point or peak of achievement
sentence: Winning the national championship was the acme of her athletic career.

definition: a devoted follower or assistant
sentence: As a devoted acolyte of the famous chef, she memorized every recipe in his cookbook.

definition: to agree without protesting
sentence: I eventually acquiesced to my friend's plan, mostly because arguing with her is like arguing with a wall.

definition: to declare not guilty of a crime
sentence: The jury acquitted the defendant after the evidence proved he was in another state that day.

definition: bitterness, discord
sentence: The acrimony between the two neighbors over the fence height lasted an impressive twelve years.

definition: an extreme fear of heights
sentence: His acrophobia was so intense that even standing on a step stool made him dizzy.

definition: to cause to act or move
sentence: Curiosity actuated her decision to open the mysterious locked box in the attic.

definition: sharp, severe; having keen insight
sentence: She had an acute sense of hearing and could detect a whispered secret from across the room.

definition: impervious, immovable, unyielding
sentence: He was adamant about not eating broccoli, even when it was disguised under a mountain of cheese.

definition: to adjust to new conditions
sentence: Chameleons adapt to their surroundings by changing color, which is honestly a superpower I'd love to have.

definition: an addition or supplement to a document
sentence: The teacher added an addendum to the syllabus that said 'No, you may not write your essay in crayon.'

definition: a person dependent on a substance or habit
sentence: She was such a coffee addict that her veins probably ran on espresso.

definition: a substance added to improve or preserve
sentence: The food additive gave the candy its neon green color and vaguely radioactive glow.

definition: to speak to or deal with a matter
sentence: The principal stood up to address the students about the mysterious pudding incident.

definition: extremely skilled
sentence: She was adept at juggling five conversations at once without losing track of any of them.

definition: to stick to something; to follow devoutly
sentence: Please adhere to the posted speed limit, or the speed camera will send you a very expensive photo.

definition: a supporter of a particular cause or belief
sentence: As a loyal adherent of the zero-waste movement, she brought reusable everything to lunch.

definition: next to or near something
sentence: The houses were adjacent, separated only by a fence and decades of passive-aggressive gardening.

definition: to be next to and share a boundary
sentence: Our hotel room adjoined the pool, which was great until the midnight cannonball competitions started.

definition: to make a formal judgment on a dispute
sentence: The judge was brought in to adjudicate the heated dispute over who invented the best cookie recipe.

definition: something added but not essential
sentence: The small café served as an adjunct to the bookstore, giving readers a place to sip while they read.

definition: to manage, direct, or give out
sentence: The nurse gently administered the vaccine while I looked away and thought about tacos.

definition: deserving of respect and approval
sentence: Her admirable patience allowed her to teach a room full of five-year-olds without losing her mind.

definition: a feeling of respect and warm approval
sentence: He gazed at the painting with such admiration that the security guard thought he was planning a heist.

definition: acceptable or valid, especially in court
sentence: The lawyer argued that the blurry photo was not admissible as evidence in court.

definition: to caution, criticize, reprove
sentence: My mom admonished me for eating cake before dinner, but her smile said she understood.

definition: to decorate
sentence: They adorned the gymnasium with streamers and balloons until it looked like a party supply store exploded.

definition: skillful, dexterous
sentence: The adroit magician shuffled the cards so fast that nobody could follow the trick.

definition: extreme praise
sentence: The rock star received so much adulation from fans that she couldn't walk ten feet without being asked for a selfie.

definition: to make impure by adding inferior substances
sentence: Someone had adulterated the lemonade with salt, and the looks on people's faces were priceless.

definition: to sketch out in a vague way
sentence: The dark clouds adumbrated the thunderstorm that ruined our outdoor concert.

definition: the arrival of a notable event or person
sentence: The advent of smartphones changed how we do everything, from ordering food to ignoring each other at dinner.

definition: antagonistic, unfavorable, dangerous
sentence: Adverse weather conditions turned our relaxing camping trip into a survival challenge.

definition: a difficult or unfavorable situation
sentence: She faced adversity with a grin, treating every setback like a plot twist in her personal movie.

definition: to call attention to; to refer
sentence: He adverted to the fine print, which is where all the sneaky details were hiding.

definition: to argue in favor of something; a person who argues in favor of something
sentence: She passionately advocated for longer lunch breaks, and honestly, the whole school supported her.

definition: artistic, related to the appreciation of beauty
sentence: The café's cozy aesthetic made everyone want to sit there all day pretending to write a novel.

definition: friendly, amiable
sentence: The affable bus driver greeted every passenger with a smile and a fun fact about the weather.

definition: to have an influence or effect on

definition: to officially attach or connect to an organization
sentence: The small gym affiliated with a national chain, which meant fancy equipment and higher membership fees.

definition: a spontaneous feeling of closeness
sentence: She had a natural affinity for languages and picked up Spanish in what felt like a weekend.

definition: to state positively; to declare as true
sentence: The coach affirmed that hard work beats talent when talent doesn't work hard.

definition: rich, wealthy
sentence: The affluent neighborhood had houses so big that getting lost on the way to the bathroom was a real risk.

definition: an insult
sentence: Serving burnt toast to a French chef was an affront that he never quite forgave.

definition: to increase or make greater
sentence: He loved to aggrandize his fishing stories until a two-pound bass became a legendary sea monster.

definition: to make worse or more serious
sentence: Poking a sleeping bear would definitely aggravate the situation, so let's not do that.

definition: a whole or total
sentence: The aggregate score from all three rounds determined the final winner of the trivia contest.

definition: quick, nimble
sentence: The agile gymnast flipped through the air like gravity was just a suggestion.

definition: to stir up or disturb emotionally
sentence: The washing machine agitates the clothes, but my little brother agitates me way more effectively.

definition: believing that the existence of God cannot be proven or disproven
sentence: She remained agnostic on the pineapple-pizza debate, refusing to take sides at the dinner table.

definition: very eager or curious to hear or see
sentence: The kids were all agog when the magician pulled an actual rabbit out of his hat.

definition: a minor illness or physical complaint
sentence: Every winter, the same ailment—a stubborn cold—would settle in and refuse to leave.

definition: without purpose or direction
sentence: After graduation, he spent an aimless summer wandering from the couch to the fridge and back.

definition: similar in nature or character
sentence: Her singing voice was akin to an angel's, if angels also occasionally forgot the lyrics.

definition: eagerness, speed
sentence: She accepted the invitation to the amusement park with such alacrity that she was packed before the call ended.

definition: a sudden fear caused by awareness of danger
sentence: The fire alarm went off during the test, and half the class looked relieved rather than worried.

definition: a medieval pursuit of turning metals into gold
sentence: Turning leftovers into a gourmet meal felt like alchemy, and my dad was the wizard behind it.

definition: a false name or identity
sentence: The spy operated under an alias so convincing that even his dentist didn't know his real name.

definition: to cause someone to feel isolated or estranged
sentence: His habit of correcting everyone's grammar began to alienate even his closest friends.

definition: to place in a straight line or bring into agreement
sentence: The planets will align next month, which astrology fans insist means something important.

definition: to assert, usually without proof
sentence: The neighbors alleged that our dog dug up their garden, but we maintained his innocence.

definition: to relieve, make more bearable
sentence: A warm cup of tea can alleviate stress faster than any motivational poster ever could.

definition: a union formed for mutual benefit
sentence: The two friend groups formed an alliance to dominate the school's trivia competition.

definition: repetition of initial sounds in nearby words
sentence: Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers is a famous example of alliteration that tortures tongues.

definition: to distribute, set aside
sentence: The student council voted to allocate most of the budget to the end-of-year dance.

definition: to refer to indirectly or hint at
sentence: She kept alluding to a surprise, dropping hints so obvious they were basically neon signs.

definition: the quality of being powerfully attractive
sentence: The allure of freshly baked cookies drew everyone into the kitchen like a magnet.

definition: an indirect reference to something
sentence: His joke about a wooden horse was an allusion to the Trojan War that only the history nerds caught.

definition: reserved, distant
sentence: The cat sat aloof on the windowsill, judging everyone in the room with silent superiority.

definition: a dispute, fight
sentence: A minor altercation over the last slice of pizza nearly ended a ten-year friendship.

definition: to occur or do in turns; every other
sentence: We decided to alternate who picks the movie so nobody has to suffer through another three-hour documentary.

definition: selfless concern for the well-being of others
sentence: Her altruism was legendary—she once gave her umbrella away in a rainstorm and walked home soaked.

definition: to bring together, unite
sentence: The two small schools amalgamated into one, which doubled both the student body and the drama.

definition: uncertain, variably interpretable
sentence: His ambiguous answer of 'maybe, probably, sort of' left everyone more confused than before.

definition: the state of having mixed or conflicting feelings
sentence: Her ambivalence about college showed when she submitted applications and gap-year plans on the same day.

definition: having opposing feelings
sentence: I'm ambivalent about rollercoasters—thrilled during the ride, terrified in the line.

definition: to walk at a slow, relaxed pace
sentence: We ambled through the park with no destination, just enjoying the sunshine and the ice cream.

definition: to improve
sentence: A simple apology can ameliorate a tense situation faster than a hundred excuses.

definition: willing, compliant
sentence: She was amenable to changing the plans, as long as food was still involved.

definition: to make changes to improve or correct
sentence: The club voted to amend the rules so that pajamas were acceptable attire at meetings.

definition: friendly
sentence: The amiable shopkeeper knew every customer by name and always threw in a free cookie.

definition: friendly
sentence: Despite the breakup, they remained amicable enough to share custody of the Netflix account.

definition: not quite right; inappropriate
sentence: Something was clearly amiss when the dog greeted us at the door wearing a guilty expression and a shoe.

definition: an official pardon for political offenses
sentence: The library declared an amnesty on overdue fines, and students returned books hidden since freshman year.

definition: lacking a moral sense; unconcerned with right or wrong
sentence: The con artist was completely amoral, treating lying the same way most people treat breathing.

definition: without definite shape or type
sentence: The amorphous blob of clay sat on the table, waiting for someone to decide if it was art or a mistake.

definition: more than enough; plentiful
sentence: There was ample room in the van for all six of us, our luggage, and somehow, a kayak.

definition: to increase in strength, volume, or extent
sentence: The microphone amplified his whisper so that the entire auditorium heard him say 'Is this thing on?'

definition: something belonging to a different time period
sentence: A knight checking his smartphone would be a hilarious anachronism in a medieval movie.

definition: a word formed by rearranging letters of another
sentence: She discovered that 'listen' is an anagram of 'silent,' which felt oddly poetic.

definition: similar to, so that an analogy can be drawn
sentence: The brain is often described as analogous to a computer, except it crashes way more often during exams.

definition: a comparison between two similar things
sentence: He used the analogy of a ship's captain to explain leadership, complete with dramatic hand gestures.

definition: to examine in detail for explanation
sentence: After she analyzed the data, she realized the experiment had gone sideways around step three.

definition: a state of disorder due to absence of authority
sentence: When the substitute teacher arrived, the classroom descended into cheerful anarchy.

definition: a cursed, detested person
sentence: Early mornings were anathema to him—his body simply rejected consciousness before noon.

definition: providing support; supplementary

definition: a short, humorous account
sentence: Grandpa's anecdote about walking uphill both ways to school got more elaborate every Thanksgiving.

definition: lacking vitality or force; weak
sentence: The team's anemic offense scored only twice the entire season, both by accident.

definition: again, in a new or different way
sentence: After the spectacular failure of version one, she started the science project anew with better glue.

definition: a deep feeling of anxiety or dread
sentence: Teenage angst filled his poetry notebook with dramatic verses about rainy Tuesdays.

definition: lively
sentence: The animated debate about the best pizza topping lasted well past midnight.

definition: strong hostility or ill will
sentence: Years of animosity between the two chefs ended in a cook-off that was televised nationally.

definition: to incorporate territory or space; a room attached to a larger room or space
sentence: The country attempted to annex the small island, but the island's five residents voted no.

definition: to destroy completely
sentence: Our team annihilated the competition so thoroughly that the scoreboard almost looked like an error.

definition: to add explanatory notes to a text
sentence: She annotated her textbook so heavily that the margins contained more words than the actual pages.

definition: to irritate or bother someone
sentence: Little brothers have a supernatural ability to annoy at precisely the worst possible moment.

definition: something that does not fit into the normal order
sentence: Snow in July would be a serious anomaly unless you live in the Southern Hemisphere.

definition: the condition of being unnamed or unknown
sentence: He enjoyed the anonymity of a big city, where nobody cared that he wore pajamas to the grocery store.

definition: being unknown, unrecognized
sentence: The anonymous donor gave a million dollars and asked for nothing in return—not even a thank-you card.

definition: a person who actively opposes another
sentence: Every great story needs an antagonist, and in my life, that role is played by my alarm clock.

definition: to provoke hostility in someone
sentence: She loved to antagonize her brother by hiding the TV remote in increasingly creative locations.

definition: something that came before

definition: to come before in time; to predate
sentence: The fossils antedate human civilization by millions of years, which really puts homework deadlines in perspective.

definition: a rousing or uplifting song of devotion
sentence: The crowd sang the anthem so loudly that the stadium itself seemed to vibrate.

definition: a selected collection of writings, songs, etc.
sentence: The anthology contained short stories from fifty different authors, so there was something for everyone.

definition: to expect or look forward to
sentence: I always anticipate the worst before a dentist appointment, even though it's never as bad as I imagine.

definition: a disappointing end after a buildup

definition: a remedy that counteracts a poison or problem

definition: lack of interest, enthusiasm, or concern

definition: the highest point or top; the climax

definition: fictitious, false, wrong

definition: expressing regret or remorse

definition: a punctuation mark or direct address to the absent

definition: to shock or dismay greatly

definition: clearly visible or obvious

definition: to make a serious or urgent request

definition: to calm, satisfy
sentence: She tried to appease the angry customer with a free dessert and a very convincing smile.

definition: to add something to the end

definition: to show approval by clapping or praising

definition: relevant or appropriate to a situation

definition: to assess the worth or value of

definition: to recognize the value or be grateful for

definition: to seize, arrest; to perceive, understand, grasp

definition: appropriate or suitable; quick to learn

definition: based on factors that appear random

definition: to settle a dispute as a neutral party

definition: chief or principal; deliberately playful

definition: of or relating to an earlier period in time, outdated

definition: very enthusiastic or passionate

definition: extreme vigor, energy, enthusiasm

definition: involving great effort; difficult and tiring

definition: to present reasons for or against something
sentence: They could argue about whether a hot dog is a sandwich for literally hours without reaching a conclusion.

definition: excessively dry

definition: the highest social class; government by nobles
sentence: In old England, the aristocracy spent most of their time throwing elaborate parties and avoiding rain.

definition: having an exaggerated sense of superiority
sentence: He was so arrogant about his cooking that he once critiqued his grandmother's Thanksgiving turkey.

definition: clever or skillful, often in a crafty way

definition: expressing ideas clearly and fluently
sentence: She was so articulate in her presentation that even the bored kids in the back row started listening.

definition: clever trickery or skill used to deceive

definition: a craftsman

definition: dominance or controlling influence

definition: to perceive, learn

definition: practicing restraint as a means of self-discipline, usually religious

definition: not straight or level; crooked

definition: to attack

definition: to express agreement or approval

definition: to state confidently and forcefully

definition: having a confident and forceful personality

definition: hard-working, diligent

definition: to absorb and integrate into a larger group
sentence: It took time to assimilate into the new school, but finding the right lunch table helped enormously.

definition: to ease, pacify

definition: to shock or greatly surprise
sentence: The magician's final trick astounded the audience so much that people forgot to clap.

definition: very clever, crafty
sentence: The astute investor noticed the trend before anyone else and made a small fortune.

definition: a place of refuge, protection, a sanctuary; an institution in which the insane are kept

definition: a person who does not believe in God
sentence: As an atheist, he celebrated the winter holidays with enthusiasm but focused on the cookies rather than the carols.

definition: to reduce in force, value, or thickness

definition: to provide evidence or proof of

definition: clothing or garments, especially fine ones
sentence: His formal attire clashed slightly with the sneakers he'd worn because his dress shoes pinched.

definition: excessively bold

definition: to add to, expand
sentence: He augmented his income by selling homemade dog treats that were suspiciously popular with humans too.

definition: a sign of what will happen; an omen
sentence: The dark clouds were an augury of the downpour that soaked everyone at the outdoor wedding.

definition: very bare, bleak

definition: genuine and real; not fake
sentence: The restaurant claimed its tacos were authentic, and the line out the door suggested they weren't lying.

definition: reliable and commanding respect
sentence: Her authoritative tone made even the class clown sit up straight and pay attention.

definition: self-governing and independent
sentence: The autonomous robot vacuum cleaned the house on its own, occasionally terrorizing the cat.

definition: excessive greed

definition: to turn away or prevent from happening
sentence: She managed to avert disaster by grabbing the falling cake just inches from the floor.

definition: having a keen interest or enthusiasm
sentence: An avid reader, she always had a book in her bag, her locker, and under her pillow.

definition: to declare or assert openly
sentence: He publicly avowed his love for pineapple on pizza despite the social consequences.

definition: away from the expected course; wrong
sentence: The surprise party went awry when the guest of honor arrived two hours early.

definition: a statement accepted as true without proof

definition: to talk rapidly in a foolish or confused way
sentence: The toddler would babble happily for hours, occasionally producing a word that sounded almost intentional.

definition: dull, commonplace
sentence: His speech was so banal that three people in the front row actually fell asleep.

definition: to send away as punishment; to exile

definition: to bring about, create, generate

definition: to carve a design into a hard surface

definition: to absorb all the attention of

definition: to improve the quality or value of
sentence: A dash of cinnamon can enhance hot chocolate from good to 'please never stop making this.'

definition: a person or thing that is mysterious or puzzling

definition: to instruct or urge someone to do something
sentence: The judge enjoined the company from selling the product until the safety investigation was complete.

definition: to give greater knowledge or understanding
sentence: Travel can enlighten you about other cultures in ways no textbook ever could.

definition: ill will, hatred, hostility
sentence: The enmity between the two chess champions was legendary, fueled by decades of close matches.

definition: the great seriousness of something; immense size
sentence: The enormity of the task didn't hit her until she realized the closet hadn't been cleaned since 2003.

definition: to improve the quality or value of
sentence: Learning a second language can enrich your life by opening doors to new friendships and cultures.

definition: to settle comfortably and securely
sentence: The cat ensconced herself in the warmest spot on the couch and refused to move for eight hours.

definition: to make certain that something happens

definition: to include as a necessary step

definition: to charm, hold spellbound

definition: having intense and eager enjoyment

definition: to attract by offering pleasure or advantage

definition: whole and complete; with nothing missing

definition: believing oneself deserving of special treatment

definition: to ask someone earnestly or anxiously

definition: to establish firmly and deeply

definition: to list or count one by one

definition: to pronounce words clearly

definition: to wrap up or surround completely

definition: feeling resentful desire for another's possessions

definition: short-lived, fleeting

definition: grand in scale or character; heroic

definition: a witty, clever, and brief saying
sentence: Oscar Wilde was famous for epigrams like calling cynics people who know the price of everything and the value of nothing.

definition: a section at the end of a book or play

definition: words written in memory of someone who has died

definition: a descriptive word or phrase for a person

definition: a perfect example, embodiment

definition: calm and even-tempered; not easily disturbed

definition: composure

definition: fair and impartial to all concerned

definition: ambiguous, uncertain, undecided

definition: to destroy completely; to eliminate

definition: unpredictable and inconsistent in behavior

definition: wrong; based on incorrect information

definition: learned

definition: to increase rapidly in intensity or scope
sentence: What started as a minor disagreement about music quickly escalated into a full-blown argument about everything.

definition: to shun, avoid

definition: understood by only a select few

definition: a short written work; to attempt

definition: absolutely necessary; extremely important

definition: to set up or create on a firm basis

definition: respect and admiration for someone

definition: to cause someone to become distant or unfriendly

definition: heavenly, exceptionally delicate or refined

definition: relating to moral principles of right and wrong

definition: elated, uplifted

definition: to escape or avoid by cleverness

definition: to assess the value or quality of

definition: tending to avoid giving direct answers

definition: fair and impartial in treatment

definition: to show, reveal

definition: to develop gradually over time

definition: to make more violent, intense

definition: making great demands; requiring precision

definition: to glorify, praise

definition: to irritate, irk

definition: to dig out of the ground and remove

definition: to go beyond a limit or expectation

definition: to be exceptionally good at something

definition: unusually good; outstanding

definition: a short passage taken from a longer work

definition: to cry out suddenly in surprise or emotion

definition: to shut out or leave out deliberately

definition: serving as a desirable model; outstanding

definition: to apply force or effort

definition: thorough and complete; leaving nothing out

definition: to make someone feel very happy and excited

definition: an urgent need or demand

definition: the state of being banned from one's home country

definition: relating to human existence and its meaning

definition: to free from guilt or blame, exculpate

definition: to become or make larger in size or scope

definition: to speed up the progress of

definition: to force out or dismiss officially
sentence: The school threatened to expel anyone caught vandalizing property, and the graffiti stopped overnight.

definition: to spend or use up resources

definition: practical contact with events; to encounter

definition: expert skill or knowledge in a field

definition: to make amends for, atone

definition: stated clearly and in detail; leaving no doubt

definition: to make use of; to take unfair advantage of

definition: to travel through or examine thoroughly

definition: to reveal or make visible something hidden

definition: to explain or present in detail

definition: effectively conveying thought or feeling

definition: existing, not destroyed or lost

definition: to make longer or stretch out

definition: covering a large area; wide-ranging

definition: to make a fault seem less serious

definition: to praise, revere

definition: to remove or pull out

definition: irrelevant, extra, not necessary

definition: very unusual or remarkable

definition: to extend known data to predict unknowns

definition: to make up, invent; the wall of a building; a deceptive appearance or attitude

definition: treating serious issues with inappropriate humor

definition: to make an action or process easier

definition: a small dissenting group within a larger one

definition: based on or concerned with facts

definition: a temporary fashion or craze

definition: to lose strength or momentum; to hesitate

definition: existing only in the imagination; whimsical

definition: meticulous, demanding, having high and often unattainable standards

definition: believing that all events are predetermined
sentence: His fatalistic attitude of 'whatever happens, happens' was either deeply philosophical or deeply lazy.

definition: to understand, comprehend

definition: extreme tiredness from physical or mental effort

definition: to pretend to feel or be affected by

definition: well suited, apt; delightful, pleasing

definition: wild, savage

definition: savagely fierce, cruel, or violent

definition: producing abundant vegetation or offspring

definition: ardent, passionate

definition: shifting in character, inconstant

definition: loyalty, devotion

definition: symbolic

definition: having limits or bounds; not infinite

definition: a defect or imperfection

sentence: The laws of physics are immutable, no matter how much you wish gravity would take a day off.

definition: to weaken or damage something
sentence: Staring at screens all day can impair your vision and your ability to have a conversation without checking your phone.

definition: treating all rivals equally; unbiased
sentence: A good judge must remain impartial, regardless of personal feelings about either side.

definition: filled with or showing great emotion
sentence: Her impassioned plea for the stray animals moved the city council to fund a new shelter.

definition: to delay or prevent by obstructing
sentence: The fallen tree impeded traffic for hours, creating a backup visible from space—almost.

definition: impossible to pass through or understand
sentence: The textbook's impenetrable prose required reading each sentence three times to extract any meaning.

definition: necessary, pressing; a rule, command, or order
sentence: It's imperative that you save your work frequently, unless you enjoy retyping entire essays from memory.

definition: so slight as to be almost impossible to notice
sentence: The changes were so imperceptible that nobody noticed the wallpaper was a slightly different shade of blue.

definition: relating to an empire; majestic and commanding
sentence: The imperial palace was so massive that visitors needed a map and comfortable shoes to explore it.

definition: rude, insolent
sentence: The impertinent student asked the principal why he didn't have to follow the same dress code.

definition: incapable of being appeased or mitigated
sentence: The implacable teacher never accepted late work, no matter how creative the excuse.

definition: an instrument, utensil, tool
sentence: The school decided to implement a new reading program after test scores dipped for the third year.

definition: to involve in an incriminating way, incriminate
sentence: The security footage implicated the person who swore they had nothing to do with the missing donuts.

definition: understood but not outwardly obvious, implied
sentence: There was an implicit understanding that whoever finished the milk had to buy more.

definition: to beg desperately for something
sentence: I implore you to try the chocolate cake—your taste buds will thank you for the rest of the week.

definition: to force something unwelcome on someone
sentence: Good neighbors don't impose their music taste on the entire building at midnight.

definition: grand and impressive in appearance
sentence: The imposing castle on the hilltop looked like it had been pulled straight from a fairy tale.

definition: lacking power or ability; helpless
sentence: The committee felt impotent to change the policy without support from the administration.

definition: to make poor; to deplete in quality
sentence: War and corruption can impoverish entire nations, leaving generations struggling to rebuild.

definition: not sensible or realistic
sentence: White carpet in a house with three dogs and two kids is charmingly impractical.

definition: lacking exactness or accuracy
sentence: The imprecise directions of 'turn left somewhere near the big tree' got us hopelessly lost.

definition: done without being planned or rehearsed
sentence: The impromptu dance party in the kitchen started when her favorite song came on the radio.

definition: to make or become better
sentence: You don't have to be perfect—you just have to improve a little bit every single day.

definition: to create or perform spontaneously
sentence: When the teleprompter broke, she had to improvise her entire acceptance speech, and it was the best one of the night.

definition: not showing care for consequences; rash
sentence: It was imprudent to spend the entire budget on decorations and leave nothing for actual food.

definition: to challenge the truth or integrity of
sentence: Before you impugn someone's character, make sure you have facts and not just gossip.

definition: silly and meaningless
sentence: The inane reality show somehow became the most-watched program on television, which says a lot about television.
